author: Kavita Upadhyay
text:
The Constitution of the country must be changed so as to ensure the safety of Hindus, says Pravin Togadia.

Calling upon Hindus to “capture political power” in the country, Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) leader Pravin Togadia on Friday said that to ensure the safety of Hindus, it was imperative that they occupied the positions of power and added to their population too.

“Hindus must democratically capture political power in the country for their safety…. The Constitution of the country and the law must be changed so that the safety and the prosperity of the Hindus become essential for an individual to come to power”, he said.

The Chief Ministers of the country, all Ministers, collectors, district judges must all be Hindus and the law must be changed to ensure it, he said.

Mr.Togadia said there must also be an “exponential” population growth of Hindus for them to be safe. “Now, the Hindus shall not reduce in number, they shall only increase,” he said, adding that more children should be born to Hindus.

Among the suggestions in the “six-point agenda” that Mr.Togadia presented for the growth in the number of Hindus, he stated that there must not be any change of religion among Hindus, nor should there be “love jihad”.

“Ghar wapasi” must be carried forward, and there must be a uniform civil code in the country.

‘Chief Ministers, Ministers, collectors, district judges must all

be Hindus ’
title: Capture political power, Togadia urges Hindus
